adjectives.description: oligotrophic (comparative more oligotrophic, superlative most oligotrophic)

entries.meaning: (physiology, of a diet) deficient in nutrition (providing little nourishment)
(biology, of a body of water) being poor in nutrients and minerals and therefore not having an excessive growth of algae and thus a no diminished oxygen content to other organisms.
(geography, of a wetland) deficient in plant nutrients, such as nitrogen or phosphorus.
